other_tests.findings: Angiographic evidence of nonexudative type 1 macular neovascularization (MNV) in the left eye.
B-scans showed shallow irregular retinal pigment epithelium elevation (SIRE) without evidence of exudation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At the last registered clinical evaluation, OCT showed no evidence of macular exudation in either eye.

other_tests.findings: The presence of drusen mostly in peripheral macula and absence of central macular atrophy.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No changes in the area of SIRE visible over time; remained stable.

other_tests.date: 16 months after the last clinical examination
other_tests.findings: Histologically confirmed type 1 MNV occupying half of the macular region, with fibrovascular tissue and normal retinal pigment epithelium.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Histologic results correlated with in vivo OCT findings despite a 16-month interval.
